article.headline: The Citadel 75, W. Carolina 66
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. -- Demetrius Nelson scored 29 points and grabbed nine rebounds to lead The Citadel to a 75-66 win over Western Carolina on Saturday night. Cameron Wells added 15 points and Austin Dahn had 10 for the Bulldogs (15-10, 10-4 Southern Conference), who won their seventh game in a row. Adrian Gailliard led the Catamounts (12-11, 7-6) with 13 points, Richie Gordon added 12 and Brandon Giles finished with 11. After trailing by five points at the break, the Catamounts took a 54-53 lead on Gailliard's free throw with 7:21 to play in the second half. But the Bulldogs went on a 22-12 run from that point to seal the win. The Citadel hit 30 of 41 free throws en route to victory, while the Catamounts went just 8-for-14 from the line.

statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
